intro: Teijsmanniodendron coriaceum, commonly known as the hard-leaved teijsmanniodendron, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important species. The plant is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves that provide structural support and reduce water loss. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, attracting various pollinators. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and horticultural collections.
